name: market for wood preservation facility, dipping/immersion tank | wood preservation facility, dipping/immersion tank | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12042/documentation

This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for  'wood preservation facility, dipping/immersion tank', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is an immobile infrastructure, representing the construction of wood preservation facility, dipping/immersion tank. The facility includes a medium size tank of 12 m length, while the batch size is between 12 - 16 m3 of wood. It has an average input of 9 l of preservative/m3 , a yearly throughput of 6,000 m3 of wood and a service life of 50 years, about 4.05E06 kg of wood preservative are applied over the service life of the tank. The process includes land area, production and decommission of building material and strorage area.

This activity starts with the built infrastructure ready to use.

This activity ends with the infrastructure made accessible to the users. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
